entry.div:
Petard
They are made better in crucible form,
hollow at the
narrower at the bottom & becoming larger toward the muzzle. It is necessary to
pestle
the
powder
thoroughly & put on top of it either
sand
or
cork
or better still a fitted plate of
wax
thoroughly
pestled
on top, for it seals precisely & makes for greater force. The ball only makes a hole, the
powder
alone makes more of an effect. One holds that, once loaded & kept in a
dry place
for fifteen
days
, they have more force.
